title: Playback Video Files Using AllPepole Player
text: Playback Video Files Using AllPepole Player , 29 September 2015 -- Turning your personal computer into a multimedia center is quite easy. You will need to have a player that will let you playback media files of various formats - video and audio. AllPepole Multimedia Player supports the playback of the following video and audio file types. Video files: AVI, MPEG, WMV, MP4, DVR-MS, MKV, FLV, OGG, etc Audio files: WAV Files (GSM, ADPCM, DSP and others), MP3 (MPEG-1/2 Layer 3, including VBR), MP2, M4A Files, WMA, Ogg Vorbis, AAC Files, MPC, AIFF (Apple), AU, etc. Read step-by-step instructions below on how to playback your home video files collection on your personal computer using this multimedia Player. First of all, after finishing installing the software, we need to select your video file you will need to locate a folder with it on your computer hard disk drive. To do that right-click within the Playback Window and select the Open File(s)... option from the Express Menu. In the opened Windows Explorer window select the place on your computer HDD where the video file is stored and press the Open button After the video file opens you can start watching it right away. But if you plan to watch several files, it is better create a list of the files for the playback so that you will not need to open them one by one - AllPepole Multimedia Player will do it for you. And thatâ€™s not all yet. If you want to further increase the impression from the movie, you will need to setup your audio environment correctly. You can do that in two ways: Move yourself in your room so that the distance between you and all the speakers were the same, or use the Speaker Calibration feature of the Multimedia Player. For the latter use the right mouse button within the Playback Window and select Speaker Configuration -> Calibration... option. As you can see, watching a home video can be as easy as that and just comfortable as well. Allpepole Multimedia Player at Mac App store:
